title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 26 May 2016 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius> has quit  
03:55 <fitz> has joined #xwiki  
05:41 <fitz> has quit  
05:43 <fitz> has joined #xwiki  
06:05 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
07:03 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
07:47 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:50 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
07:51 <vmassol> has quit  
07:55 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
07:59 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:29 <iuliab> has joined #xwiki  
08:55 <iuliab> has quit  
09:01 <fitz> has quit  
09:02 <fitz> has joined #xwiki  
09:07 <fitz> has quit  
09:11 <boubou> has quit  
09:14 <fitz> has joined #xwiki  
09:16 <maya\_\_> has quit  
09:29 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:30 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:34 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:34 <vmassol1> good morning  
09:34 <vmassol1> After the move to contrib I'm hesitating in refactoring the package for the jira macro since there are several public interface I have there (used as extension points).  
09:34 <boubou> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
09:35 <vmassol> they're probably not used by anyone but still hesitating…  
09:35 <tmortagne> vmassol: I guess you could put old API in aspects  
09:35 <vmassol> in that case I'll need to handle both in the internal  
09:35 <vmassol> both = old api + new api  
09:36 <tmortagne> not sure what you mean  
09:36 <vmassol> (new api = new api in new package)  
09:36 <tmortagne> you call the new API in the aspects  
09:36 <vmassol> that doesn't work  
09:36 <vmassol> I have components  
09:36 <vmassol> thus roles  
09:36 <vmassol> I have about 4  
09:36 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:37 <vmassol> the macro impl uses those interface to lookup component impls  
09:37 <vmassol> these components are still needed  
09:37 <vmassol> it's the classical package rename issue  
09:37 <vmassol> not many choices  
09:37 <tmortagne> right you still need to lookup the old component so aspects won't help  
09:39 <vmassol> I think I could just drop backward compat  
09:39 <vmassol> I don't think anyone is using it at all and if they do, it's not such a big deal to change the package name  
09:40 <tmortagne> well the issue usually not changing the package but having an extension which work with both old and new version  
09:40 <tdi> has quit  
09:41 <tmortagne> so it's just is it ok to break retro compatibility in this case or not, I guess it is  
09:41 <tmortagne> (with a big warning in the documentation of course)  
09:41 <vmassol> I don't understand  
09:41 <vmassol> the interface is inside the extension jar  
09:41 <vmassol> so if you update the extension you get the new api with the new package  
09:41 <vmassol> org.xwiki.contrib.rendering.macro.jira  
09:41 <vmassol> org.xwiki.contrib.jira  
09:42 <vmassol> FTR for markdown I've used org.xwiki.contrib.rendering.markdown but it's all internal so it can be changed easily  
09:42 <tmortagne> "so if you update the extension you get the new api with the new package" again it's not that simple, if you want you extension to work with XWiki LTS and 8.2 you can't because there is no common API  
09:43 <tmortagne> retro compatibility is not about making easier to upgrade your dependency at build time  
09:43 <vmassol> I don't understand  
09:43 <vmassol> the extension can be installed in LTS or in 8.2  
09:43 <vmassol> and it'll work in both  
09:44 <vmassol> I have an alias on it (ie feature) so if you have an old version of it, it'll be upgraded  
09:44 <tmortagne> then it conflict with the one existing in LTS branch  
09:44 <vmassol> it's not bundled :)  
09:44 <vmassol> by default  
09:45 <tmortagne> you can't have both at the same time so you can't have extension using the new API and extension using the old API at the same time  
09:45 <vmassol> yes that's why I have a feature set  
09:45 <vmassol> <xwiki.extension.features>org.xwiki.rendering:xwiki-rendering-macro-jira</xwiki.extension.features>  
09:45 <vmassol> so the user will never have both installed  
09:46 <vmassol> am I missing something?  
09:46 <tmortagne> you as a user might not control the extension of jira macro you are using so you can't "update the extension" to use new API  
09:46 <tmortagne> " so the user will never have both installed" that's my point  
09:46 <vmassol> if you don't update the jira macro then you get the old version with the old packages  
09:47 <vmassol> if you update it then you get the new version with the new packages  
09:47 <vmassol> where's the problem?  
09:47 <tmortagne> you can answer that every time you break an API, "if you want old API to work, don't upgrade" :)  
09:48 <vmassol> or upgrade your code  
09:48 <tmortagne> again you are only looking at it trough extension dev point pov view  
09:48 <tmortagne> but breaking an API means breaking not up to date extensions for the user  
09:49 <vmassol> sure that's the main decision  
09:49 <vmassol> and why I was hesitating  
09:49 <vmassol> but as I said I doubt anyone is using this api nayway  
09:49 <vmassol> \*anyway  
09:49 <vmassol> and if there's 1 person in the world doing it, they can update the package they use  
09:49 <tmortagne> I'm just saying that's all retro compatibility is about, so either you break it or you don't  
09:50 <vmassol> sure....  
09:50 <vmassol> that was the initial point, not sure why we're discussing this ;) anyway  
09:50 <vmassol> re package name you have an opinion?  
09:50 <vmassol> since it's hard to change thereafter I prefer more opinions  
09:51 <tmortagne> don't we have a rule for contrib jar extension packages ?  
09:51 <tmortagne> don't remember  
09:51 <vmassol> I'll also introduce a new JIRAConfiguration interface  
09:51 <vmassol> nope  
09:51 <vmassol> all we say  
09:51 <vmassol> is that it must start with org.xwiki.contrib  
09:51 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <tmortagne> or so we do have a rule :)  
09:51 <vmassol> actually we don't even have this written but it's a expectation  
09:52 <vmassol> (that we have in voted mails)  
09:52 <tmortagne> since the module is called jira I guess org.xwiki.contrib.jira is good  
09:52 <vmassol> the only issue  
09:52 <vmassol> is that if another module is contributed about jira  
09:52 <vmassol> like for example when we move the current jira module from platform  
09:52 <vmassol> when we move into contrib  
09:52 <vmassol> we'll need a paclage for it  
09:53 <vmassol> ofc it could be in a different repo and still use the same package but maybe not very nice, I don' know  
09:53 <tmortagne> you can have sevral jar with the same packages as long as it's not the same classes  
09:53 <tmortagne> and you are not going to put everything in org.xwiki.contrib.jira here, you will have internal and probably macro subpackage too  
09:53 <vmassol> ideally the package should be an isoltaed namespace to avoid clashes  
09:54 <vmassol> that's why I was suggesting org.xwiki.conrib.jira.macro  
09:54 <tmortagne> I was talking about org.xwiki.contrib.jira as a prefix  
09:54 <vmassol> ok so org.xwiki.contrib.jira.macro would be good I guess  
09:55 <tmortagne> if we move jira module we should probably put it in the same project than this macro  
09:55 <tmortagne> to synchronize them with the jira API  
09:55 <vmassol> I wouldn't do that  
09:55 <vmassol> they're completely different  
09:55 <vmassol> and using coimpletely different apis  
09:55 <tmortagne> shouln't they use same API ?  
09:56 <vmassol> no  
09:56 <vmassol> it's different  
09:56 <vmassol> they're not doing the same thing  
09:56 <vmassol> for the macro I tried to use the same api and it didn't work  
09:56 <tmortagne> so there is several different jira APIs ?  
09:56 <vmassol> yes  
09:56 <vmassol> so we're using direct http access for the macro for ex  
09:56 <tmortagne> then sure they should not be in synch indeed  
09:57 <vmassol> and the jira u platform is using JRJC: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/JIRA+Module  
09:57 <tmortagne> direct http access is not an API :)  
09:57 <tmortagne> I was talking about jira side API  
09:57 <vmassol> which had limitations for the jira macro  
09:58 <vmassol> was missing one api  
09:58 <vmassol> I don't recall which one though...  
09:58 <vmassol> but I remember having to recode everything  
09:58 <vmassol> using HTTP instead of JRJC  
09:59 <vmassol> but JRJC is more powerful in general, progress support, etc  
10:02 <daemoen> bah, tmortagne beat me to responding, thats what i get for not refreshing before i repond.. was busy digging through logs to remember what i had done to do the same thing myself =D  
10:03 <daemoen> oh, and my response got rejected anyway for some reason... now thats even more amusing =D  
10:04 <daemoen> any idea why my response to threads would be rejected by server even though im a subscriber to said list? (xwiki-users list)  
10:05 <vmassol> daemoen: there's only 2 reasons  
10:05 <vmassol> 2 reasons it can happen that is  
10:05 <vmassol> 1) you're sending with a different email address than the one registered  
10:05 <vmassol> 2) you're answer mail is larger than 100K  
10:05 <vmassol> checking  
10:05 <daemoen> shouldnt be either of those, strange  
10:06 <vmassol> on users list?  
10:06 <vmassol> it's not 2)  
10:06 <vmassol> just checked moderation queue  
10:06 <daemoen> yeah, it flat out rejected the email, lol  
10:06 <vmassol> the mail you got back should tell you the reason normally  
10:06 <daemoen> 'You are not allowed to post to this mailing list'  
10:06 <tmortagne> wrong mail then  
10:06 <vmassol> what email have you used?  
10:07 <daemoen> i wonder... let me check something  
10:07 <daemoen> nope  
10:07 <vmassol> sent you the mail privately that you're registered under  
10:08 <vmassol> so you need to use this one :)  
10:08 <vmassol> ie the mail that arrives on the liset server must be with this address  
10:08 <vmassol> \*list server  
10:08 <tmortagne> or register the other mail to not worry about it :)  
10:08 <vmassol> or that  
10:08 <daemoen> lol, ill have to;  you can't send email using an alias =D  
10:09 <daemoen> and here i thought i was being slick by making it easy to sort my mails from various lists  
10:09 <vmassol> hmmm tmortagne we need to setup revapi in the top level poms for contrib too  
10:09 <vmassol> and we need a top level parent-rendering pom too  
10:09 <tmortagne> it's not in commons-pom ?  
10:09 <vmassol> ah I know  
10:09 <vmassol> my bad  
10:09 <vmassol> it's just that I depend on 6.4  
10:10 <vmassol> ….  
10:10 <vmassol> commons-pom 6.4  
10:10 <vmassol> clirr should have told me about the backward comapt issue though  
10:10 <vmassol> let me check the 6.4 pom  
10:11 <vmassol> ah I rmeember  
10:11 <vmassol> clirr is only set up in commons-core  
10:11 <vmassol> or in platform-core  
10:11 <vmassol> so it's not by default  
10:11 <vmassol> same for revapi actually  
10:11 <vmassol> (AFAIR-  
10:12 <tmortagne> why ?  
10:12 <vmassol> yup  
10:12 <vmassol> we could put it at the top but then we need to exclude it from all places where we don't want it  
10:12 <vmassol> enterprise, tools, dev-tools, etc  
10:12 <tmortagne> sure but it's a few skip properties to add so it's fine IMO  
10:13 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <tmortagne> re parent-rendering, I tough about it but it was going to contain pretty much the same thing that parent-commons but sure you can add it just to be safe  
10:14 <daemoen> am i missing the register link on the site in order to add comments/contribute to the docs ?  
10:14 <vmassol> daemoen: it should be there  
10:14 <vmassol> top right in the drawer  
10:14 <daemoen> login, home, wiki index, page index  
10:14 <tmortagne> yes it's a bit hidden now  
10:15 <daemoen> yeah, it wasn't on the login page as a register link either =D  
10:15 <tmortagne> hmm indeed we lost register on subwikis  
10:15 <tmortagne> go to www.xwiki.org  
10:15 <daemoen> ahh, interesting  
10:15 <tmortagne> evalica: looks like we don't have register on subwiki anymore on xwiki.org  
10:16 <vmassol> it was a trick before  
10:16 <tmortagne> yes  
10:16 <vmassol> we need to fix this in xwiki platform itself  
10:16 <vmassol> some config option  
10:16 <evalica> tmortagne: what was the trick?  
10:16 <vmassol> basically daemoen we only want global users on xwiki.org  
10:16 <evalica> it's because of skin?  
10:16 <tmortagne> wasn't it a link in the skin for subwikis ?  
10:16 <tmortagne> but we should not need that anymore  
10:16 <daemoen> vmassol: ahh, makes sense  
10:16 <vmassol> I think it was  
10:17 <tmortagne> we have "only main wiki" setup for users now  
10:17 <tmortagne> checking  
10:17 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <daemoen> curiously, shouldnt at least the registration page be under https ?  
10:19 <vmassol> would be nice indeed  
10:20 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <lucaa> has quit  
10:21 <tmortagne> register link should be fixed for all wikis now  
10:22 <vmassol> tmortagne: what did you do?  
10:22 <vmassol> the subwikis configs were wrong?  
10:22 <tmortagne> guest did not had register right on subwikis  
10:22 <vmassol> ah ok  
10:22 <vmassol> errr wait  
10:22 <vmassol> users are not registered locally I hope  
10:22 <tmortagne> since it was a hack in the skin before it was not needed  
10:22 <tmortagne> no they are not  
10:22 <vmassol> ok  
10:22 <vmassol> cool then  
10:23 <vmassol> didn't realize we were supporting this  
10:23 <tmortagne> we have you end up on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/register/XWiki/XWikiRegister?xredirect=%2Fxwiki%2Fbin%2Flogin%2FXWiki%2FXWikiLogin%3Fsrid%3DWgpUqZrC%26xredirect%3D%252Fxwiki%252Fbin%252Fadmin%252FXWiki%252FXWikiPreferences%253Feditor%253Dglobaladmin%2526section%253DUsers%2526srid%253DWgpUqZrC  
10:23 <vmassol> nice  
10:23 <tmortagne> which is xwiki.org specific  
10:23 <tmortagne> but we are supposed to support it in XE too when you choose "only main wiki users" I think  
10:23 <tmortagne> if we don't then it's a bug  
10:27 <daemoen> there, that should save a \*little\* bit of time for people looking for more info on how to do python libraries inside xwiki  
10:28 <vmassol> cool thanks daemoen,not sure why the irc bot is not working again...  
10:28 <daemoen> comments are usually the safest path so I'll let you guys decide how you want it in the page itself  
10:28 <tmortagne> daemoen: would be even better in a section of the page :)  
10:28 <vmassol> note: you can use wiki sytax in comments  
10:28 <tmortagne> looks good to me  
10:29 <vmassol> yes would be nicer in the page :)  
10:29 <daemoen> ok ok ;)  one min  
10:31 <tmortagne> great that it's so easy to use pip with jython, I was thinking about doing a repository handler for pypi so that you can install python module trough extension manager but never got the time  
10:31 <daemoen> yeah,  the only thing to remember is that you don't need the full egg, just the actual library.  if you wanted to \*fully\* bundle it and repack, then you need the egg =D  
10:31 <tmortagne> the loading the egg file part is easy but need to find some time on the pypi API  
10:32 <tmortagne> sure but pypi provide egg files, rigth ?  
10:32 <daemoen> yes  
10:32 <daemoen> you wind up with the egg files with pip too  
10:33 <tmortagne> don't pop download stuff on pypi ?  
10:33 <tmortagne> s/pop/pip/  
10:33 <daemoen> right;  think of the egg as the python version of the java manifest  
10:33 <tmortagne> yep that's what I understood and it's actually so similar to a JAR that just loading it as a JAR might just work  
10:34 <tmortagne> all I did to put pgments on maven central was to put the content of the egg in a jar  
10:34 <tmortagne> \*pygments  
10:35 <tmortagne> speaking of which looks like there is a new verison of pygments  
10:36 <tmortagne> 2 actually  
10:41 <daemoen> there :p  
10:41 <daemoen> i like how you can wrap the code inside of a second code tag in order to retain syntax highlighting without having to escape the macro brackets =D  
10:42 <daemoen> thats a nifty trick i hadnt seen before  
10:43 <tmortagne> great, thank !  
10:46 <vmassol> daemoen: yup, we had to be clever in the implementation of this ;)  
11:07 <samo> has joined #xwiki  
11:08 <samo> is now known as <Guest83609>  
11:11 <Guest83609> HI, I'm looking for the one I used to call morgane, just know it was just a problem in the hibernate, I did not "UNCOMMENT" correctly all the lines in hibernate, good day  
11:11 <Guest83609> has quit  
11:12 <acotiuga> Pbas: Related to http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13443, the List of Users property works as a suggest of existing users in the wiki.  
11:13 <acotiuga> IMO in that case is not used on its purpose  
11:13 <acotiuga> I'm not sure what you want to achieve  
11:14 <acotiuga> I'm closing the issue as Won't fix  
11:15 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:17 <Pbas> acotiuga: My purpose wasn't user creation  
11:18 <Pbas> If I have a custom application with NON multi select user list  
11:19 <acotiuga> so it should keep only one user  
11:19 <Pbas> I want only one entry if I fill my form  
11:19 <Pbas> in this case, I have 2 users but display one  
11:19 <acotiuga> so you want to be limited to 1 entry when you add them ?  
11:19 <acotiuga> yes because it is designed to keep only one  
11:19 <acotiuga> NOT multi select  
11:19 <Pbas> yes  
11:20 <sagarhani> has quit  
11:20 <daemoen> It's too bad the playground resets every day  
11:20 <Pbas> now view and edit mode doesn't display same things  
11:20 <vmassol> daemoen: why?  
11:20 <vmassol> what's your use case?  
11:21 <daemoen> awe, we can't use the script macro like i wanted anyway  
11:21 <Pbas> yes acotiuga then it is an issue  
11:21 <daemoen> vmassol: http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/PythonScriptExample/  
11:22 <vmassol> hehe  
11:22 <vmassol> we need to make it work! ;)  
11:22 <Pbas> do you want a xar file?  
11:22 <daemoen> its a fun little example that shows how easy but powerful it can be to use a scripting language like python inside of xwiki;  its my favorite way of showing off to people that have never seen xwiki.  I paste that same page in and they go "wow!"  
11:22 <vmassol> yo just need PR  
11:22 <acotiuga> So we're talking here about a mistake of somebody who's trying to add 2 or more users while it shouldn't  
11:22 <vmassol> ...  
11:23 <vmassol> working now  
11:23 <vmassol> ;)  
11:23 <vmassol> @daemoen: you could publish this as a snippet on extensions.xwiki.org  
11:23 <vmassol> or as an example on the python script macro page  
11:24 <vmassol> (woud be even better probably)  
11:24 <daemoen> I was debating it, might have to remove the snarky little jab though, lol  
11:25 <vmassol> hehe  
11:25 <Pbas> yes, when i dev an xwiki application with not multiselect field, I don't want my user can fill 2 values  
11:25 <vmassol> usually we capture output for e.x.o  
11:25 <vmassol> so that we don't execute it live  
11:25 <sagarhani> has joined #xwiki  
11:26 <Pbas> acotiuga: if user typing existant user "not multi select' feature working well  
11:27 <acotiuga> is unknown user  a member of wiki? Is it a created user, or is just a name ?  
11:27 <Pbas> but if he fill my forms with none existant user, 2 values are filled  
11:28 <Pbas> just some text  
11:28 <Pbas> not a xwiki member  
11:28 <martinus\_\_> hi all, is there an easy and efficient way to implement a JSON RPC client in xwiki page ?  
11:28 <acotiuga> So were going back to the fact that only existing  users should be typed there and/or use suggested ones  
11:29 <acotiuga> so this is an invalid input , but i'll take a look to fix this  
11:29 <Pbas> no because we haven't this feature in "list of user" property  
11:29 <Pbas> we haven't "limit to xwiki user"  
11:30 <Pbas> I want "list of user" property respect "not multi selected" feature  
11:31 <Pbas> "I want" I mean "it will be cool if " ;)  
11:32 <Pbas> To resume, "not multi selected" feature working well ONLY for xwiki user  
11:40 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, vmassol do you know if it's possible to use an http client to send POST data in xwiki ? like httpclient for groovy ?  
11:41 <vmassol> martinus\_\_: sure, any client will work  
11:42 <tmortagne> martinus\_\_: you can do whatever you want with groovy  
11:42 <martinus\_\_> I mean to have a page in xwiki that do a request to a PHP script in post mode  
11:42 <vmassol> martinus\_\_: works too  
11:42 <vmassol> ;)  
11:42 <vmassol> I have done that  
11:42 <martinus\_\_> could you lead me to an example  
11:42 <martinus\_\_> ?  
11:42 <vmassol> there must be some groovy example on e.x.o  
11:43 <vmassol> search on the groovy tag  
11:43 <martinus\_\_> and velocity ?  
11:43 <tmortagne> martinus\_\_: do you mean executing php inside a page or just having a form that lead somewhere else ?  
11:43 <vmassol> that's harder in velocity since you'd need an http api  
11:43 <martinus\_\_> having a xwiki form that lead somewhere  
11:43 <vmassol> we do provide a simple one to get the content at a url  
11:43 <vmassol> but no post  
11:43 <tmortagne> then it's very easy  
11:43 <tmortagne> all you need is {{html}} macro  
11:43 <tmortagne> and you you html form in there  
11:44 <tmortagne> see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/HTML+Macro  
11:45 <tmortagne> you put your html <form> and when the user click the submit button it will send the request to the external website  
11:45 <tmortagne> it's just plain standard html, the only thing related to XWiki is the {{html}} syntax you put around  
11:50 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, but what if we want to check the form values in xwiki before sending them to the php script ?  
11:51 <tmortagne> then it's not about a form leading to somewhere else is about a from leading to XWiki :)  
11:51 <vmassol> has quit  
11:51 <tmortagne> so for the form you can use {{html}} macro, then for the XWiki page receiving the form data the easiest is probably to use Groovy  
11:52 <tmortagne> to do whatever to need to do before using httpclient to call the other website  
11:52 <tmortagne> it all depend how complex what you need to do is  
11:53 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, ok but httpclient is embeded in standard in groovy ?  
11:54 <tmortagne> groovy can use all Java classes available but I think it also have some http helper  
11:54 <tmortagne> but I don't know groov enough to give you an example  
11:54 <tmortagne> "groovy http" on google should probably give you what you need  
11:55 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, I think it's http://javadox.com/org.codehaus.groovy.modules.http-builder/http-builder/0.6/groovyx/net/http/HTTPBuilder.html  
11:55 <tmortagne> looks like it  
11:57 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, how I can check if this class is currently available in my xwiki instance ?  
11:58 <martinus\_\_> well I know, it's programming knowledge :)  
11:58 <martinus\_\_> a bit out of topic  
11:58 <martinus\_\_> in fact  I need the good 'import' statement  
12:04 <tmortagne> martinus\_\_: "how I can check if this class is currently available in my xwiki instance" you test :)  
12:04 <tmortagne> but this specific class seems to be something embedded in groovy so you should always have it  
12:05 <tmortagne> I think everything documented on Groovy website documentation should be available to you (except when the doc explicitly say it require some external library)  
12:19 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, thanks  
12:19 <tmortagne> martinus\_\_: you're welcome :)  
12:20 <martinus\_\_>   module="http-builder", version="0.5.1") before hand  
12:21 <tmortagne> hmm so it's not embedded in groovy (grab download dependencies on maven central)  
12:22 <tmortagne> if you don't want to download something you can use https://hc.apache.org/ which is embedded in XWiki  
12:23 <tmortagne> but it's probably not as Groovy oriented as http-builder is  
12:34 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, thanks. Well it would need some import line at some point too  
12:35 <martinus\_\_> seems vmassol is implied into this ;)  
12:53 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki
